p: LC 50 values of recombinant HearNPVs were determined by the droplet feeding method [ 47]. Late second instar H. armigera larvae were placed in 24-well sterile plates and starved overnight at 28 °C. The following morning, larvae that had molted third instar were used for bioassays. The polyhedrosis virus was set to 3 × 10 5 OBs/mL, 1 × 10 5 OBs/mL, 3 × 10 4 OBs/mL, 1 × 10 4 OBs/mL, and 3 × 10 3 OBs/mL suspensions. The starving third instar larvae were fed with the different suspensions of OBs mixed with 4% sucrose and 1 mg/mL blue dye (erioglaucine disodium salt, Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA). The larvae whose midgut changed to blue in 10 min were transferred individually into a 24-well plate containing fresh artificial diet. The mortality rate was observed twice a day until all larvae died or pupated. Each OB suspension concentration was tested using 24 larvae and the experiment was performed twice. The LC 50 values were analyzed by Probit regression analysis and compared by z-test in SPSS (IBM SPSS Statistics 22.0, Armonk, NY, USA).
